messageBody:
Here is how I add custom assertion methods. YMMV.

1. Write a test.
2. Feel need for custom assert.
3. Q: Can I write it as a query method (answers boolean) and use a
simple failure message?
A: [Yes] No need for a custom assert:

assertTrue("My Custom AssertionFailed Message", myCustomQueryMethod());

[No] Write the assert in the TestCase.
4. Feel need for same custom assert in a different TestCase.
5. PULL UP custom assert to new abstract TestCase class one level up in
hierarchy.
6. Feel need for same custom assert in a different test case, but
TestCase inheritance now leaves bitter taste in mouth.
7. PULL OUT custom assert into MyCustomAssert class which extends
junit.framework.Assert.

It all depends on which needs are felt when.

Take care.

So said Manuel Amago on 2003-02-03 --------------------
